EnhancedContent:
GitHub’s improved repository creation experience is now generally available. When you create a new repository, you’ll see a streamlined workflow that makes setting up repositories faster and more intuitive.

## Highlights

- When you create a new repository, there’s an updated flow with clearer guidance for required fields.
- The new experience helps you get set up quickly and confidently.
- Inputs now respond to organization and enterprise policies for custom properties, making governance-driven rules easier to adopt.

## Additional updates

- You can now add the merge queue bot as a [bypass actor for rulesets](https://docs.github.com/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/managing-rulesets/creating-rulesets-for-a-repository#granting-bypass-permissions-for-your-branch-or-tag-ruleset) for repository and organization rulesets. Now merge queue branches (e.g., `gh-readonly-queue/**`
) work as expected while allowing you to blocking updates from other actors.
- We’ve updated the repository insights [commits page](https://github.com/github/codeql/graphs/commit-activity) to make the commit graph accessible to screen readers. You can also view commit data as a table or download it as a CSV or PNG.

### Feedback

We want to hear from you! To provide feedback or ask questions, visit the [feedback discussion](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/categories/repositories).
Description:

The post [Improved repository creation generally available, plus ruleset & insights improvements](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-08-26-improved-repository-creation-generally-available-plus-ruleset-insights-improvements) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
Author: Allison
Title: Improved repository creation generally available, plus ruleset & insights improvements
